meanings.definition: To write or inscribe on a scroll.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys enscrolling her thoughts on ancient scrolls.
meanings.sent2: The historian was enscrolling the important events of the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The wizard enscrolling his spells on a magical scroll made a mistake and turned himself into a frog.
meanings.sent4: Her words enscrolling the parchment seemed to come alive with each stroke of the quill.
meanings.sent5: The artist enscrolling intricate designs on the scroll mesmerized all who beheld his work.

meanings.definition: To record or document in a scroll.
meanings.sent1: The scribe diligently enscrolling the royal decree for future generations.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists discovered a tomb enscrolling the history of a long-forgotten civilization.
meanings.sent3: The chef enscrolling his secret recipe on a scroll to prevent others from stealing it.
meanings.sent4: The poet enscrolling his emotions on paper felt a sense of release and freedom.
meanings.sent5: The teacher enscrolling the lesson on a scroll made learning more engaging for the students.

meanings.definition: The act of writing or inscribing on a scroll.
meanings.sent1: The enscrolling of ancient tales on scrolls fascinated the young readers.
meanings.sent2: In the library, one could see the enscrolling of history on various scrolls.
meanings.sent3: The enscrolling of the wizard's spells on a magical scroll caused quite a commotion in the village.
meanings.sent4: The enscrolling of the prophecy on the ancient scroll foretold a great calamity.
meanings.sent5: The enscrolling of the map on a scroll guided the adventurers through treacherous lands.
